DRO_B Satellite / SMILE Satellite

April 16, 2025

Focus: high-stability, high-dynamic GNSS onboard receiver that is highly interference-resistant, high-sensitivity, multi-band, and multifunctional.

These two projects were the national key Distant Retrograde Orbit (DRO) exploration research and the China–Europe SMILE (Solar wind–Magnetosphere–Ionosphere Link Exploration) mission. Our team was primarily responsible for designing the satellite’s onboard receiver, which supports multi-constellation, multi-frequency GNSS signals (e.g., GPS Lx, BDS Bx, Galileo Ex, and GLONASS Gx main bands). In these projects, I led the system protocol design, developed the system reconfiguration functionality, and implemented the intermediate-frequency data acquisition module. Testing showed that the newly introduced reconfiguration feature improved update speed by approximately 25% compared to the previous manual download method.
